inclusion.criterion: History of simple or complex partial epilepsy that has been documented or witnessed
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: during a 12-week baseline phase, patient must have at least 12 partial seizures while maintaining therapeutic levels of anti-epileptic drugs (AEDs)
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: and have no more than one seizure-free interval of up to 3 weeks and none longer than 3 weeks
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Females who are capable of having children
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: patients with treatable causes of seizures (for example, infections)
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: patients with a progressive disorder of the nervous system
exclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: patients with history of status epilepticus (repeated or prolonged seizures) while on antiepileptic therapy
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: history of serious disease of the heart, liver, kidneys, gastrointestinal, metabolic, or endocrine system
exclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: history of alcohol or drug abuse within one year prior to study initiation
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient has a history of epilepsy, CHF, and depression. He had seizures in the past but was maintained on Dilantin and phenobarbital for 20 years without another seizure. However, he was recently tapered off Dilantin and had no further events during his hospital course.
